Package renderer.scene.util

Class ModelShading

java.lang.Object
renderer.scene.util.ModelShading
public class ModelShading extends Object
This is a library of static methods that add color shading to a Model.

  • Method Summary

    Method
    Description
    static Color

    • setColor

      public static void setColor(Model model, Color c)
      Set each front face Color in the Model's color list to the same Color.
      Parameters:
      model - Model whose color list is being manipulated
      c - Color for all of this model's Vertex objects

    • setRandomColor

      public static void setRandomColor(Model model)
      Set each front face Color in the Model's color list to the same random Color.
      Parameters:
      model - Model whose color list is being manipulated

    • setRandomColors

      public static void setRandomColors(Model model)
      Set each front face Color in the Model's color list to a different random Color.
      Parameters:
      model - Model whose color list is being manipulated

    • setColorShaded

      public static void setColorShaded(Model model, Color c)
      Set each front face Color in the Model's color list to the same Color but randonly shaded brighter and darker.
      Parameters:
      model - Model whose color list is being manipulated
      c - Color for all of this model's Vertex objects

    • setRandomColorShaded

      public static void setRandomColorShaded(Model model)
      Set each front face Color in the Model's color list to the same random Color but randonly shaded brighter and darker.
      Parameters:
      model - Model whose color list is being manipulated

    • setRandomNestedModelColors

      public static void setRandomNestedModelColors(Model model)
      Give each of this Model's nested models a different random front face Color.
      Parameters:
      model - Model whose color list is being manipulated

    • setRandomVertexColors

      public static void setRandomVertexColors(Model model)
      Set each Vertex in the Model to a different random Color.

      This creates a "rainbow model" effect.

      NOTE: This will destroy whatever "color structure" the model might possess. AND it deletes any back face colors that the model might have.

      Parameters:
      model - Model whose color list is being manipulated

    • setRandomPrimitiveColors

      public static void setRandomPrimitiveColors(Model model)
      Set each Primitive in the Model to a different (uniform) random Color.

      NOTE: This will destroy whatever "color structure" the model might possess. AND it deletes any back face colors that the model might have.

      Parameters:
      model - Model whose color list is being manipulated

    • setPrimitiveColorShaded

      public static void setPrimitiveColorShaded(Model model, Color c)
      Set each Primitive in the Model to a different (uniform) shade of the given Color.

      NOTE: This will destroy whatever "color structure" the model might possess. AND it deletes any back face colors that the model might have.

      Parameters:
      model - Model whose color list is being manipulated
      c - Color for this model's Primitive objects

    • setRainbowPrimitiveColors

      public static void setRainbowPrimitiveColors(Model model)
      Set each Primitive in the Model to a different random Color at each endpoint.

      This creates a "rainbow primitive" effect.

      NOTE: This will destroy whatever "color structure" the model might possess. AND it deletes any back face colors that the model might have.

      Parameters:
      model - Model whose color list is being manipulated

    • setBackFaceColor

      public static void setBackFaceColor(Model model, Color c)
      Set a uniform back face color of each OrientablePrimitive in the Model to the given Color. The given Color object c is added to the Model's color list.
      Parameters:
      model - Model whose back face color is being manipulated
      c - back face Color for all of the Model's Face primitives

    • setBackFaceColor

      public static void setBackFaceColor(Model model, int cIndex)
      Set a uniform back face color of each OrientablePrimitive in the Model to the Color with the given color index into the Model's color list.
      Parameters:
      model - Model whose back face color is being manipulated
      cIndex - back face Color index for all of the Model's Face primitives

    • setBackFaceColor

      public static void setBackFaceColor(Model model, Color c0, Color c1, Color c2)
      Set the back face colors of each OrientablePrimitive in the Model to the given Colors. The given Color objects are added to the Model's color list.
      Parameters:
      model - Model whose color list is being manipulated
      c0 - back face Color for all of the Model's Triangle primitives
      c1 - back face Color for all of the Model's Triangle primitives
      c2 - back face Color for all of the Model's Triangle primitives

    • setBackFaceColor

      public static void setBackFaceColor(Model model, int cIndex0, int cIndex1, int cIndex2)
      Set the back face colors of each OrientablePrimitive in the Model to the Colors with the given color indices into the Model's color list.
      Parameters:
      model - Model whose color list is being manipulated
      cIndex0 - back face Color index for all of the Model's Face primitives
      cIndex1 - back face Color index for all of the Model's Face primitives
      cIndex2 - back face Color index for all of the Model's Face primitives

    • randomColor

      public static Color randomColor()
      Create a Color object with randomly generated r, g, and b values.
      Returns:
      a reference to a randomly generated Color object
